page.title: 01Farmlands East of Lockton
page.content: An area of dissected plateaux originally moorland. Elevation around 200 metres. A good deal of land reclamation to pasture. Mainly sheep with some store cattle. Lockton Village busy centre years ago but now mainly holiday lettings and Bed/ Breakfast. Not even a pub, bisected by road Pickering - Whitby. South East corner afforested by Forestry Commission dating back to 1920. The National Trust Area "The Bridge Stones" - weathered jurassic rocks lies in north east corner. The Dalby Forest Drive bisects the south east corner. Very popular area for walkers and summer visitors. About 7 farms in the block.
